conclusion: Analyze forces to determine conditions for logs to start sliding.
Centers of logs form an equilateral triangle with side length 2R, angle O1 is 120 degrees.
Normal force from each log (B or C) on log A is mg/2.
Normal force from the ground on each log (B or C) is 3mg/2.
Frictional force is mu times normal force, f = mu * 3mg/2.
Horizontal component of normal force from log A on log B (or C) is mg√3/4.
Balance horizontal force with frictional force, f = mg√3/4.
Dynamic friction factor between ground and logs is √3/6.
